intro: Uva marenteria, commonly known as the African black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible but contain toxic compounds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Uva marenteria is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
